PCSA
Hello world! Settings
Reporting Process Learn all about reporting Reporting Types Reporting Services Reporting Steps Contact Staff to Report More Reporting Resources Confidentiality Learn More about the Reporting Types FAQ Types Get Help Now Post Staff Services available for both Standard and Restricted reports are as follows:

 · Medical Care related to injury, pregnancy, or sexually transmitted infections

 · A sexual assault forensic exam (SAFE) to preserve evidence 

 · Counseling from a licensed mental health professional

 · Medical evacuation

 · Accompaniment during medical evacuation

 · Safety planning

 · Explanation of your legal options
 
 · Assistance with making and going to appointments related to the assault (SARL assistance)

 · Help understanding your rights and ensuring that you receive the services requested (victim advocate assistance)
CServices only available with a Standard Report

 · Consultation with my Country Director

 · File a report with local law enforcement

 · Request a site change

 · Request a host family change

 · File a sexual misconduct complaint against another Volunteer/Trainee (Administrative Hearing)

 · Request the Peace Corps Office of Inspector General conduct an investigation

 · Request the Peace Corps Office of Civil Rights and Diversity conduct an investigation
